title: The Best Coding Practices For Beginners
summary: One of the best practices for beginners who are learning to code is to use meaningful variable names. When you write code, you’re writing a set of instructions that a computer can execute. The computer needs to know what “clicks” means, so you have to write that in code. Always use const unless you have a good reason not to. Make sure to stay on top of current programming practices and languages. Some languages are trending upwards in popularity, while others are declining.

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"When you take your first coding class, you\u2019ll quickly realize just how much thought goes into writing code. From naming conventions to formatting standards, there are a ton of rules and best practices that experienced programmers follow to make sure their code is clean and easy to read by others. This can feel overwhelming at first. It might seem like there are a million things you need to know before you even get started on your first coding project. However, trust us \u2013 it\u2019s not as scary as it may seem! Following coding best practices will not only help you get through future programming classes more easily but also prepare you for a career in software development. In this blog post, we\u2019ll explore some of the most important best practices for beginners who are learning to code."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Use meaningful variable names"),mdx("p",null,"One of the most important best practices for beginners is to use meaningful variable names. This may sound silly since the code is only visible to you, but you\u2019ll be surprised at how much easier it will be to understand your code when you use descriptive variable names. For example, say you want to track the number of times a user clicks a button. You could name that variable something like \u201CbClicks\u201D, but that doesn\u2019t really convey what the variable is used for. Instead, you could name that variable \u201Cclicks\u201D and write a sentence about what the variable is being used for. You might say \u201Ctracks the number of times a user clicks a button\u201D. That way, when you go back to your code months later, you\u2019ll be able to understand what\u2019s going on more easily."),mdx("h2",null,"Comment your code"),mdx("p",null,"Comments are lines of code that won\u2019t be executed but are intended to provide more information about what\u2019s happening in your code. Comments are one of the best practices for beginners who are learning to code. Every time you write code you should include a comment that describes what that code is doing. You\u2019ll find that as you work through more advanced coding projects, you\u2019ll be able to look back at your code and understand what\u2019s happening more easily if you\u2019ve used comments to explain everything."),mdx("h2",null,"Only use English in your code"),mdx("p",null,"Coding isn\u2019t just about writing syntax or using loops and loops. It\u2019s also about writing logic that computers can understand. When you write code, you\u2019re writing a set of instructions that a computer can execute. For example, if you want to enable a feature, you can write code that says \u201Cif a user has a certain payment method, then enable that payment method.\u201D These instructions are meant to be read and understood by a human, but they\u2019re also meant to be read and understood by a computer. At the same time, there are certain things that are specific to the computer \u2013 things like the names of variables, loops, and functions. For example, the computer needs to know what \u201Cclicks\u201D means, so you have to write that in code. But when you\u2019re writing the code, you don\u2019t want to use words that are specific to a human. You want to use words that are specific to the computer. When you write code, you can only use words that the computer understands. You can\u2019t use any words that are specific to humans. That\u2019s why when you write code, you have to only use English. You can\u2019t use any other languages like Spanish, French, or Chinese."),mdx("h2",null,"Always use const unless you have a good reason not to"),mdx("p",null,"Constants are values that you don\u2019t want to change, so you declare them as a constant. This lets the computer know that this value won\u2019t change over time, so it can make some calculations easier. When you\u2019re learning how to code, you\u2019ll find that you\u2019ll use constants quite often. You\u2019ll use them for things like the number of days in a month, the number of hours in a day, or any other value that you know won\u2019t change. When you\u2019re first learning how to code, it\u2019s important to always use const unless you have a good reason not to. The only time you would not use const is if you wanted a value to change over time. For example, if a button needs to change colour over time, you wouldn\u2019t use a constant. If a number needs to change depending on what someone inputs, you wouldn\u2019t use a constant. You would always use a constant unless you have a good reason not to."),mdx("h2",null,"Make sure to stay on top of current programming practices and languages"),mdx("p",null,"One of the best practices for beginners who are learning to code is making sure to stay on top of current programming practices and languages. Some languages, like Python, have been around for decades, while others like Rust are brand new. Some languages are trending upwards in popularity, while others are declining. No matter which language or programming practices you decide to learn, it\u2019s important to keep on top of what\u2019s happening in the industry. You never know when a programming skill will come in handy! You also don\u2019t want to be caught off guard if a potential employer asks you about your knowledge of certain languages or practices. Keep an eye on industry publications for new programming languages and trends, and make sure to follow industry leaders on social media. This will help you stay up to date with everything that\u2019s happening in the industry and make sure that you\u2019re prepared for whatever the future may hold!"),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"As you can see, there are a lot of important best practices that you should follow as a beginner learning to code. It can seem overwhelming at first, but if you follow these best practices, you\u2019ll be well on your way to becoming a successful coder!"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Coding Frameworks for Developers

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Today\u2019s app developers face intense pressure to develop high-quality products that meet multiple user needs in the shortest amount of time and with the fewest resources possible.
The solution is coding frameworks, which are libraries of pre-written code designed to assist developers in meeting these demands. These coding frameworks make it easier for coders to build applications that serve a specific function or group of functions, but require a lot of time and effort to create from scratch. There are many coding frameworks available for coders working on software projects. Which framework you choose will depend on what you\u2019re developing, your skill level as a coder, and your long-term goals as an employee or freelancer who develops software for businesses or other professionals. Keep reading for more details about some of the most common coding frameworks.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get Started with Coding

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Coding is an essential skill that can be applied to a variety of roles, industries and company sizes. What started as a niche skill used by software developers is now a marketable and relevant skill for almost every industry. It has become so ubiquitous that even the Department of Labor has highlighted coding as one of the fastest growing skills in demand.
Coding is most commonly thought of as the ability to create websites, apps and software. However, there are actually many different types of coding. Computer programming (or coding) involves writing instructions for computers so they perform certain actions or functions. The type of coding you choose to learn may have different applications depending on your interests, career trajectory and personal strengths. Read on to learn more about the various types of coding, as well`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Use Code Snippets Effectively

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Having access to thousands of code snippets online is a double-edged sword. On the one hand, they make it easy to insert commonly used code into your document. On the other hand, it\u2019s so easy to just insert them that most people won\u2019t take the time to understand how they work. After all, why spend 15 minutes learning something when you can just copy and paste it instead? However, using code snippets effectively is important if you want to save time and effort in the long run.
There are many benefits that come with using code snippets effectively. For example, they can help you reduce the amount of time spent on repetitive tasks. You\u2019ll also learn new information about different programming techniques while reducing your chances of making a common mistake. Keep reading to learn how you can use code snippets effectively.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Coding Tools for Developers

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Developers do a lot of work. As with any job, coders have to balance the amount of time spent coding as well as the quality and efficiency of that coding. It is an ongoing challenge to stay organized and productive throughout the day. The good news is that there are many tools out there that make the lives of developers easier. These tools make tasks like code organization, file sharing, debugging, and testing much simpler.
Coding tools help developers in multiple ways. They streamline processes such codification, debugging, testing, and management of code libraries. Additionally, these tools reduce redundancy and increase efficiency across projects and teams as a whole rather than individually. Let\u2019s take a look at some of the best coding tools that every developer should know about!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Debug Your Code like a Pro

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Are you an exceptional programmer? Sure, you can code in multiple programming languages fluently, debug any issues you encounter, and implement algorithms like a pro. But what happens when your code crashes again and again? Or it works perfectly on paper but not in practice? What do you do when you have no idea what\u2019s going wrong or why the code isn\u2019t working as intended? Well, if that sounds like you \u2014 as a programmer \u2014 then keep reading because we have some good news for you! Debugging your code is one of the most challenging and demanding tasks as a coder. It requires patience, precision, and analytical skills to identify where things aren\u2019t working correctly and why. However, with the right strategies and techniques, debugging your code doesn\u2019t need to be a painful process. Here are some helpful tips on how to debug your code like a pro:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Coding Ides for Developers

They can also master complex code and find solutions to difficult technical problems. But beyond that, great coders bring something else to the table: they have a unique combination of traits that make them productive and effective programmers. The best coders have a set of common habits that allow them to thrive in an often stressful environment. There are many pressures on software engineers, from tight deadlines to the constant demand for new features. Great coders are able to thrive in this pressure-filled environment because of their ability to manage stress, focus intently, and think creatively about the problem at hand.
